value.0: The hermit sips his glass of honey mead and looks at you with a startled expression. "Who are you? What do you think you are doing in here?"
"You have come to steal my honey, haven't you? You... you look familiar. Did I catch you stealing my honey before?"
"Wait! I remember now. There was some kind of voice. I was supposed to welcome you, make you feel comfortable. Right. Well... Welcome! Make yourself comfortable..."
"The voice? Oh, yes, the voice. I was supposed to welcome you, make you feel comfortable. Right. Well... Welcome! Make yourself comfortable..."
"Oh, it's so hard to get comfortable these days. I need to go to the keep and sell some honey... but I just can't go near people right now. Even just having you here... it scares me."
"Yes, of course. Don't steal any honey on your way out either!"
"Having to deal with people makes me terrified. To think of actually going back into the keep... it is too much for me. I do not know how I will ever manage to sell my honey."
"That would be... better. If I had one person I could trust to deal honestly with me. Would you find someone like that for me?"
"Then why don't you just leave me alone? I bet you don't have time for anything with all the honey you've been stealing from me!"

Comment.value:
give pc 100 gold
set that pc was given gold

value.0: "I... I guess that makes sense. Here is 100 gold. That should motivate you to find me an assistant."
"I... I am tired. Why don't you just wander out of here and run your errands for the keep now? Don't steal any honey on your way out."
"I... I guess that makes sense. Here is... wait... my gold is gone. Oh, sure! First my honey and now my gold! I hate thieves! I don't trust you anymore. Get out of my house!"
"I could not ask that of you. No, you are too important. The voice said you had important things to be doing for the keep. If you could just find someone to assist me, that would be good enough."
"That... that would be nice. Please try to find someone honest."
"There is nothing wrong with my honey! I have the best honey for leagues. Why, my honey sells so well that I have added a new hive so that I can get more."

"You are just trying to trick me so you can steal my honey! Well, this is one hermit who won't be tricked so easily! You can just get out of my house and do what business you must for the keep, young <man/woman>!"
"So you can steal my honey, you mean! You think I will fall for that old trick?"
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> "You can threaten me all you want, but I will not be falling for your foolishness!"
"I shall not be destroyed by the likes of you!"
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> "If you think that's for the best, I guess I'll have to trust you. The one on the far left is new. I will speak to the bees and ask them not to harm you."
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> "Oh dear, my poor bees! You must save them. The one on the far left is new. I will speak to the bees and ask them not to harm you."
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> "You are a sneaky one, but I will not be falling for your foolishness!"
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> "If you think that's for the best, I guess I'll have to trust you. The one on the far left is new. I will speak to the bees and ask them not to harm you."
"That's impossible... or is it? I was in such a hurry... I don't know if I searched the crate very carefully. No... you are just trying to trick me so you can steal more honey!"
"It is one of the ones on the end. On the left side, I am pretty sure. But you stay away from my honey! My bees will sting you if you touch their hives!"
"Good hermit, look at me. Look past the scars and you will see my nature."
"Mighty lady... you are a nymph! But what are you doing in this land? Are you here to establish a sacred grove?"
"Nay, good hermit. My journey with <FirstName> is not of that nature. You must listen to what I say. Something is poisoning your honey and causing your mind to be weakened. We will help you."
"This is true? But a creature such as yourself would have no reason to lie to a druid. It must be so."
"I recently added a new hive. The one on the far left is new. I will speak to the bees and ask them not to harm you."
"Please do. Let us go quickly, <FirstName>. Who knows how long this poor man's mind will be with us. Let's discover what poisons the sweet honey."
"Did I? What a strange thing. I am sure I must have had a reason... can't think of one though."
Kaidala closes her eyes. "There is something unnatural in that drink. I'm not sure what, but I suspect that's where the hermit's problems stem from."
Trip sniffs near the glass of mead. "Ick! Something more than just honey in this drink, Trip is certain. Don't be drinking the stuff."

Comment.value: if pc speaks to hermit after finding dagger, but before being rewarded.

value.0: "Did you find anything?"
"I'm not going to be able to keep the bees off of you for long, so hurry up."
"You did? I wonder what it was doing in an old crate in the forest? I guess it doesn't matter now."
"That... that looks like the blade of an assassin. I wonder what it is doing in an old crate in the forest? I guess it doesn't matter now. You can keep the blade. I'm sure it is worth quite a bit."

Comment.value:
give pc 1000 xp
give pc jar of honey
mark plot over

value.0: "Here is some honey, from one of the good hives. But I grow more tired by the hour so, forgive me, but I must bid you goodbye."
"That nice, young girl from the keep came and helped me. You wouldn't believe it, but she found a poisoned blade in my beehive. I think I am getting better now. Thank you for all your help."
"Take this jar of honey. It is the least I can do for all of the trouble you went to. Goodbye."

Comment.value: if pc helped cure the Hermit

value.0: "Thank you so much for all your help. I am starting to recover my mind and I think I might make a visit to the keep to sell my honey soon."
"Thank you. You too."
"Did you now? And who might be so bold as to steal from me?"
"I would rather not have my honey stolen any more. I guess I could pay you something for the information. How does two hundred gold sound?"
"How much do you think I make from selling honey? You can have two hundred gold, or you can keep the information to yourself. Your choice."
"Kobolds? That's not so good. Honey is definitely something you want to share with kobolds. It affects their minds in strange ways."
"I guess that's one way of solving the problem. Too bad though, I would have liked to study them and possibly help them."

Comment.value:
give 200 gold and 500 xp
Can only be rewarded for this once. Close this thread once he is told.

value.0: "Here is two hundred gold for your trouble. I am glad you came back to tell me."
"That is troubling. Still, I should be able to study them and perhaps even help them. I am glad you told me about this."

Comment.value: give pc 200 gold, the club of the hermit q1_hermitclub, 500 exp and close this thread.

value.0: "Here is two hundred gold for the information. And why don't you take this old club I used to like. I have better weapons now, but maybe you can find a use for it."
"Not at all. It does quite the opposite. It makes them relax and experience strange dreams. An entire kobold tribe on honey is completely defenseless."
"Did you? Well, well, well... three holes in the ground."
"Sorry, an old joke. Deep thoughts for a shallow mind. That sort of thing. So, who is the assassin?"
"Like a big child that taunts another child with candy, you bring information and say 'I know something you don't know'."
"But since I do not care one way or the other, my feelings are not hurt. Any more waves you would like to crash against my beach?"
He rolls his eyes and whistles like a bird. "I make as much sense as sunshine on a rainy day. One does not necessarily disclude the other."
"Worth? Like the hour to the hand of a clock, it is information, but not something that the clock cares about."
"You can tell me the information, and I'll appreciate it, but I don't care enough to pay you for it."
"Garrot? I've met him. Interesting fellow. Didn't realize he was an assassin, but it does explain why he's so nervous. Twitchy fellow."

Comment.value: Give 500 XP if this is the first time PC has spoken to hermit.

value.0: "Might have to go have a talk with him about leaving poisons where others can get at them. Thank you for the information. Is there anything else?"
"As you were so kind and helpful to me, I should return the favor."

Comment.value: First time met. When dialogue ends for any reason, except for combat, the Hermit will go into his house.

value.0: An odd, wild-eyed man, with bees swarming around his body, looks at you warily. "You're here to steal my honey, aren't you? That's it... aye, must be! Wait... no, the voice. It said <he/she> would come."
"A voice in my head... never a good sign. It said... it said... wait, who are you? If you come to steal my honey, you're in for some serious trouble. Or did the voice send you?"
"It told me that a <man/woman> would be coming here and I should make them feel welcome."
"It's mine! I found the bees, I fed the bees, I take care of the bees, I gather the honey combs, and I bottle the honey; so you can't have any!" The hermit pauses, breathing rather hard.
"Unless you plan on buying some. If you came as a customer... then I am sorry for my rant. Are you sure the voice didn't send you?"
"Oh... well then. That is the name the voice gave me. My apologies. It's just that someone has been bothering my bees and stealing my honey. I've grown a touch suspicious of strangers."
"But that is none of your trouble. Please, come into my home and I could make you some tea with honey, or you can have some wonderful honey mead."
"Oh, yes... the voice did say something about that. Big work, important work, the stuff of Destinies even."
"I just... I hate people... can't trust them... they steal my honey. I... I need to go inside."
"No... well, maybe over a pint of mead. Come, shall we go inside?"
"Excellent. I haven't had a visitor in a long while. Follow me please."
"There is something wrong with this poor man, <FirstName>. If you could convince him to calm down, I might be able to help him."
"I think this one hears the voices too. Don't trust him, but have pity on his poor soul. The voices are cruel and vicious."
"I have business to attend to on behalf of the keep."
"I'll be leaving now."
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> "The voice sent me, remember?"
"Goodbye."
"What scares you?"
"Would you like to have someone sell your honey for you?"
"I don't have time for that."
"I'll need a finder's fee first though."
"I will sell it for you."
"I will find someone."
<StartAction>[Insight]</Start> "Have another drink of honey mead."
"There is something wrong with your drink."
"This isn't worth the bother."
"I'll need you to control your bees so that I can look at the new hive."
<StartCheck>[Intimidate]</Start> "Call your bees off, or I end your life!"
"Then you must die!"
<StartCheck>[Bluff]</Start> "Whatever is poisoning you could be killing your bees."
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> "I just need to check the one hive."
"I'll bet that the problem is with the new hive."
"Which is the new hive?"

Comment.value:
set bees to not attacking.
when pc picks up poisoned blade, set hermit to cured.

value.0: "We just met outside. You invited me in."
"Not yet."
"I found a poisoned dagger, but I have given it away."

LinkComment.value:
give pc 1000 xp
give pc jar of honey
mark plot over

value.0: "I found this dagger."
"Good luck."
"I found your honey thieves."
"How much is the information worth to you?"
"Not enough."
"I'm not telling you."
"There's a group of kobolds who really like it."
"They are all dead."

Comment.value: if pc gave them honey and didn't kill the kobolds.

value.0: "I gave them some honey."
"Does it make them dangerous?"
"I found the owner of that poisoned blade."
"Have you been into the bad honey again?"
"What?"
"I'm not telling you."
"You don't make a lot more sense when you aren't poisoned."
"How much is the information worth to you?"
"What does that mean?"
"An innkeep named Garrot was once an assassin."
"Would you be able to heal me?"
"What did the voice tell you?"
"Honey?"
"My name is <FullName>."
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> "I am <FirstName>. The voice sent me."
"I haven't time. I have work to do on behalf of the keep."
"Tell me your troubles."
"Thank you. I would appreciate that."
